statements: SELECT id, features, label FROM training_data;
SELECT label, features, id FROM training_data;
SELECT * FROM training_data WHERE id = 1;
SELECT id, label FROM training_data WHERE label = 'positive';
SELECT features FROM training_data WHERE id > 3;
SELECT * FROM training_data WHERE id = 1;
SELECT id, label FROM training_data WHERE features LIKE '%example%';
SELECT * FROM training_data ORDER BY id DESC;
SELECT DISTINCT label FROM training_data;
SELECT COUNT(*) AS total_records FROM training_data WHERE label = 'spam';
SELECT training_id, feature_1, feature_2, label FROM training_data;
SELECT label, feature_1, feature_2, training_id FROM training_data;
SELECT feature_1, label, training_id, feature_2 FROM training_data;
SELECT * FROM training_data WHERE label = 'positive';
SELECT feature_1, feature_2 FROM training_data WHERE feature_1 > 0.5;
SELECT training_id, feature_1, label FROM training_data;
SELECT feature_2, feature_1, training_id, label FROM training_data ORDER BY feature_2 ASC;
SELECT model_id, model_type, learning_rate FROM model_params WHERE max_iterations > 100;
SELECT label, feature_1, feature_2 FROM training_data WHERE feature_1 > 0.5 AND feature_2 < 0.3;
SELECT * FROM training_data JOIN model_params ON training_id = model_id;
SELECT * FROM training_data;
SELECT id, data_input FROM training_data ORDER BY id DESC;
SELECT * FROM model_parameters WHERE parameter_name = 'learning_rate';
SELECT model_name, accuracy, precision FROM model_performance WHERE accuracy > 0.8;
SELECT COUNT(*), AVG(accuracy) FROM model_performance;
SELECT * FROM training_data ORDER BY id DESC LIMIT 10;
SELECT data_input, label FROM training_data WHERE id > 100 AND label = 'positive';
SELECT AVG(accuracy) AS average_accuracy FROM model_performance;
SELECT model_name, accuracy, precision FROM model_performance WHERE recall >= 0.8 ORDER BY accuracy DESC;
SELECT parameter_name, parameter_value FROM model_parameters WHERE parameter_value > 0.5;

SELECT id, label FROM training_data WHERE id = 1;
SELECT * FROM training_data WHERE label = 'positive';

SELECT COUNT(*) FROM training_data WHERE features IS NOT NULL;

SELECT id, features FROM training_data WHERE features LIKE '%important%';
SELECT id, features, label FROM training_data ORDER BY label ASC, id DESC;
SELECT * FROM training_data ORDER BY id DESC;
SELECT feature1, feature2, target FROM training_data WHERE id = 5;
SELECT COUNT(*) as total_rows FROM model_parameters;
SELECT * FROM model_performance WHERE accuracy > 0.9 ORDER BY evaluation_date ASC;
SELECT training_date, epochs, time_taken FROM training_history WHERE time_taken < 10;
SELECT * FROM training_data WHERE target > 0.5 ORDER BY feature1 DESC
SELECT id, feature1, target FROM training_data WHERE feature2 < 0.7 ORDER BY id ASC
SELECT parameter_name, parameter_value FROM model_parameters ORDER BY parameter_value DESC
SELECT id, evaluation_date, accuracy FROM model_performance WHERE accuracy > 0.8 ORDER BY evaluation_date DESC
SELECT training_date, epochs, time_taken FROM training_history ORDER BY time_taken ASC
